meanings.definition: The state or quality of being broken or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The brokennesses of the old vase made it impossible to repair.
meanings.sent2: The brokennesses of the window were evident from the cracks.
meanings.sent3: The brokennesses of the toy car made it look like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her heart carried the brokennesses of past relationships like heavy baggage.
meanings.sent5: The brokennesses of the bridge were a stark reminder of its age and neglect.

meanings.definition: Instances of being broken or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The box contained various brokennesses of glass and ceramics.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed brokennesses of ancient pottery found during excavations.
meanings.sent3: The pile of brokennesses in the garage resembled a collection of forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the brokennesses of mirrors to create a unique mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The brokennesses of the city streets reflected years of wear and tear.
